posts.post_content:
[Fate Transfer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fate Transfer) won't work unless you [animate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=21377) the dephs and can bring up another creature.  
But [Æther Snap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Æther Snap) will work just fine with that land for sure.  
  
The best choice for this is certainly Zendikar's [Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage), though. A simple two card combo that easily gives you a 20/20 indestructible flyer on turn three? At any time!
posts.html:
Fate Transfer won't work unless you animate the dephs and can bring up another creature.
But Æther Snap will work just fine with that land for sure.

The best choice for this is certainly Zendikar's Vampire Hexmage, though. A simple two card combo that easily gives you a 20/20 indestructible flyer on turn three? At any time!

posts.post_content:
I love the art on this card and the flavor of this card. If I see this come out on to the field on turn one and I am up against it I am going to sweating bullets (thankfully it dosen't have trample). Its not often you see many huge game wining creatures coming out of lands so I liked the idea, its also a lot of fun to try figuring out ways to make it easier to get out.
  
   
One word though for when this creature final does come in play [Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boomerang ) .

One word though for when this creature final does come in play Boomerang .

posts.post_content: [Æther Snap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Æther Snap) sounds like a good combo, until you read its fine print. It says "remove all counters from all permanents and remove all tokens from the game." So it would remove the legendary creature token (it states "bring token into play" on the Dark Depths card). Unless this somehow plays on a stack where the token comes into play after the Aether Snap. A ruling by the magic officials would be good on that point. If this works I give it a five, otherwise I give it a three since you would have to get a perfect combo of a few cards or protect the land for a while before bringing it into play.
posts.html:
Æther Snap sounds like a good combo, until you read its fine print. It says "remove all counters from all permanents and remove all tokens from the game." So it would remove the legendary creature token (it states "bring token into play" on the Dark Depths card). Unless this somehow plays on a stack where the token comes into play after the Aether Snap. A ruling by the magic officials would be good on that point. If this works I give it a five, otherwise I give it a three since you would have to get a perfect combo of a few cards or protect the land for a while before bringing it into play.
